description: A formal protocol for the agent to propose, validate, and implement improvements to its own operational protocols and tools.

rules.description: Proposals for self-improvement must be initiated via the `self_improvement_cli.py` tool.
rules.enforcement: The `self_improvement_cli.py` tool will create a new branch and a proposal markdown file in the `proposals/` directory.

rules.description: Improvement proposals must be formally structured, including sections for 'Problem Statement', 'Proposed Solution', 'Success Criteria', and 'Impact Analysis'.
rules.enforcement: The `self_improvement_cli.py` tool will generate a template with these required sections.

rules.description: Any proposed changes to protocols must be implemented in the relevant source files within the `protocols/` subdirectories, not directly in the generated AGENTS.md files.
rules.enforcement: Pre-submit checks will fail if generated AGENTS.md files are modified directly.

rules.description: After protocol source files are modified, the `protocol_compiler.py` must be executed to re-compile the protocols and validate the changes.
rules.enforcement: A pre-submit git hook will trigger the compiler and block the commit if compilation fails.

rules.description: The success of an improvement must be verified by running relevant tests or a new, specific verification script.
rules.enforcement: The improvement proposal must reference the specific tests or scripts used for verification.
